DOC.brief_summary: To determine the most cost effective way to treat children with perforated appendicitis we will randomize all children presenting with perforated appendicitis to initial operation, with in 24 hours of admission, or to initial antibiotics, with or without percutaneous drainage, and subsequent interval appendectomy after 8 weeks. Our outcomes will include cost, complications, length of stay, and quality of life measures.
DOC.brief_title: Initial Versus Delayed Operation for Treatment of Complicated Appendicitis In Children
DOC.criteria: children Age 217 with a diagnosis of perforated appendicitis Age <2 and >18 Pregnancy Immunocompromise
